name: merge-agent-handler
title: Merge Agent Handler
summary: Securely connect AI agents to third-party tools via MCP with centralized access control, logs, and security alerts.
description: Merge Agent Handler is an MCP gateway that sits between your AI agent and third-party tools. Use one MCP connection to expose exactly the connectors and tools you want (via Tool Packs), bind the session to an end user or service account (via Registered Users), and monitor every tool interaction with searchable logs, custom header-based grouping, and configurable security rules/alerts.

useCases.name: Unified connector surface for agents
useCases.description: Expose many third-party apps behind a single MCP endpoint so agents can integrate with new tools without changing runtime wiringâ€”just update the Tool Pack.

useCases.name: Agent tool governance
useCases.description: Use Tool Packs to restrict an agent to the exact third-party tools it can invoke, and swap permissions per agent/use case without changing the agent code.

useCases.name: Multi-app workflow orchestration
useCases.description: Enable cross-app workflows (e.g., create a ticket, notify a channel, update a CRM) using one MCP connection while keeping consistent tool boundaries.

useCases.name: Monitoring & auditability
useCases.description: Track tool calls with detailed, searchable logs and group calls by workflow/chat using custom X-* headers.

useCases.name: Environment & tenant portability
useCases.description: Promote the same agent from dev to prod by switching Tool Pack and user context identifiers while keeping the MCP client configuration stable.

useCases.name: Security controls & alerts
useCases.description: Apply inbound/outbound security rules to warn, redact, or block sensitive data from moving through tool calls, and generate alerts on violations.

mergeAgentHandlerBearerAuth.description: Authenticate with a Merge Agent Handler access key using the Authorization header (Bearer token).
